meanings.definition: To become a parent of (a child) by law, or to accept an animal as a pet and become responsible for it.
examples: The grandparents adopted one of their grandchildren, and now they are her parents.

images.description: A grandparent holding a tiny baby.
images.caption: Grandparents may sometimes adopt their grandchildren.

source.title: Woman in Yellow Knit Sweater Carrying Baby
source.author: Jake Ryan

meanings.definition: A positive feeling or action shown towards someone or something considered important, or held in high regard.
examples: It may be hard to get the respect of younger siblings when you are not much older than they are.

meanings.definition: A big effort; a fight; combat.
examples: It was a struggle to do homework and take care of his little brother at the same time.

images.alt: Photo of person on a computer.
images.description: A person with a frustrated expression, trying to do work on a computer.
images.caption: It can be a struggle to get homework done when also taking care of younger sisters or brothers.

source.title: Man in White Shirt Using Macbook Pro
source.author: Tim Gouw
